makemore.utils package

Submodules

makemore.utils.aux module

class makemore.utils.aux.EarlyStopping(patience: int = 5, delta: float = 0, verbose: bool = False, val_loss_min: float = inf, filepath: str = './checkpoint.pt')

Bases: object

Stops the training process and checkpoints the states of the training components of a seq-to-seq model.

The stopping occurs if the loss value during the validation step stops decreasing for a number of epochs specified by the patience.

Parameters:

  • patience (int, optional) – Number of epochs to wait before early stopping. (default=5).

  • delta (float, optional) – Minimum change in monitored quantity to qualify as an improvement (default=0).

  • verbose (bool, optional) – If True, logs a message for each improvement. Defaults to False.

  • filepath (str, optional) – Path to write the checkpoint. Should include either .pth or .pt as the file extension. Defaults to './checkpoint.pth'.

makemore.utils.aux.generate(model: Module, indices: Tensor, max_seq_length: int, temperature: float = 1.0) → Tensor

Generates a number of sequences of indices.

Each sequence of indices is completed by feeding the previous sequence of indices into the model to predict the next index until the sequence reaches the max_seq_length.

Parameters:

  • model (torch.nn.Module) – The neural network model.

  • indices (torch.tensor) – The initial sequence of indices where each sequence is consisting of only one index.

  • max_seq_length (int) – The maximum sequence length.

  • temperature (float, optional) – Controls the randomness of the model’s output.

Returns:

The completed sequences of indices.

Return type:

torch.tensor

makemore.utils.aux.load_from_txt(input_file: str) → List[str]
makemore.utils.aux.load_general_checkpoint(model: Module, optimizer: Optimizer, filepath: str) → Dict[str, Any]

Loads a general checkpoint.

Parameters:

  • model (torch.nn.Module) – The model to be updated with its saved state_dict.

  • optimizer (torch.optim.Optimizer) – The optimizer to be updated with its saved state_dict.

  • filepath (str) – The file path of the general checkpoint.

Returns:

  • ‘model’: The updated model with its saved state_dict.

  • ’optimizer’: The updated optimizer with its saved state_dict.

  • ’epoch’: The epoch value from the last checkpoint.

  • ’loss’: The loss value from the last checkpoint.

Return type:

A dictionary containing the following keys

makemore.utils.aux.print_samples(model: Module, vectorizer: CharTokenizer, device: str = 'cpu', num: int = 10) → None

Samples from the model and pretty prints the decoded samples.

makemore.utils.aux.set_seed(seed: int = 42) → None

Sets random seeds for torch operations.

Parameters:

seed (int, optional) – Random seed to set (default=42).

makemore.utils.aux.write_checkpoint(epoch: int, model: Module, optimizer: Optimizer, val_loss: float, filepath: str = './checkpoint.pth') → None

Saves the states of the training components and also the last validation loss and epoch.

Parameters:

  • epoch (int) – Current epoch.

  • model (torch.nn.Module) – The language model.

  • optimizer (torch.optim.Optimizer) – The optimizer.

  • val_loss (float) – Loss value during validation.

  • filepath (str, optional) – Path to write the checkpoint. Should include either .pth or .pt as the file extension. Defaults to './checkpoint.pth'.
